cmCourseInfo.description: An intensive introduction to Latin for students who have no knowledge of the language; preparation for the reading of Latin literature.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introductory Latin I
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: LAT100Y1. Students who have studied Latin previously must obtain permission from the Undergraduate Coordinator before enrolling.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Students will be expected to view video content prior to scheduled meetings. A microphone and webcam will be required to participate.

cmCourseInfo.description: A continuation of the intensive introduction to Latin in LAT 101H1. Also appropriate for students who have some training in Latin, but have not completed a whole credit course at University or a final-year (Grade 12) course in secondary school.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introductory Latin II

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

At this time, the University has not made a final decision about course delivery for the Winter 2021 term. The Faculty of Arts & Science will be updating Winter term course delivery information based on public health guidelines.

cmCourseInfo.description: Reading of selections of Latin prose works with systematic language study.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Latin I
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: LAT100Y1/LAT102H1. Grade 12 in Latin may be accepted, but students should consult the Undergraduate Coordinator before enrolling.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

All contact hours will be devoted to Latin instruction and translation activities of one kind or another.

cmCourseInfo.description: Continued language training with readings in Latin prose and verse.
cmCourseInfo.title: Intermediate Latin II

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Students need to have access to Quercus and e-mail and the ability to use Zoom.

cmCourseInfo.description: Readings from one or more Latin novelists.
cmCourseInfo.title: Latin Novelists I

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

For remote participation, students will need Bb Collaborate, a webcam and microphone.

notes.name: Section Note
notes.content: December 2, 2020: Delivery method changed.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Following U of T guidelines, this course will be taught online only, synchronously. We shall read speeches by Cicero, beginning with the First Catilinarian followed by the Second Philippic and parts of the Second Catilinarian.

cmCourseInfo.description: Readings from one or more Latin epics, including Virgil.
cmCourseInfo.title: Latin Epic I

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Students need to have access to Quercus and e-mail and the ability to use Microsoft Teams.

cmCourseInfo.description: Readings from one or more Latin satirists.
cmCourseInfo.title: Latin Satire I

notes.name: Course Note

cmCourseInfo.description: Independent Studies. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Applicants should first contact a potential supervisor for the proposed project. Once they have the supervisor's agreement, they should bring it to the Undergraduate Coordinator, Room 110, 125 Queen's Park or email undergrad.classics@utoronto.ca

cmCourseInfo.description: Advanced readings from Latin orators, including Cicero.
cmCourseInfo.title: Latin Orators II

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Following U of T guidelines, this course will be taught online only, synchronously. We shall read the same texts as in LAT 342(Cicero's First Catilinarian followed by the Second Philippic and parts of the Second Catilinarian), and in addition from Tacitus’ Dialogus de oratoribus.
